results.title: In a 1988 Murder, DNA Is Used to Identify Both the Victim and Her Killer
results.abstract: The authorities employed genetic genealogy to solve a mystery: A 19-year-old “free spirit” traveling the country was killed by a truck driver, who left her body on an interstate in Georgia.

media.caption: With information from forensic genealogy testing, the authorities now believe a body left on an interstate in north Georgia was that of Stacey Lyn Chahorski, 19, who was hitchhiking across the United States.

results.abstract: After taking a decade between studio releases, Cedric Bixler-Zavala and Omar Rodríguez-López eased their sonic experimentation to the sidelines for an album that still bristles.
